title: Artisan: Kuna
description: Kuna is committed to creating high quality garments using the art and magic of Peru’s millennial textile manufacturing tradition. produces beautiful pieces fibers from South American camelids, like alpacas, while protecting each species preserving ancient valuable knowledge Incas merged with latest technology. combines worlds textures colors that constitute legacy, a legacy comprised manual skill secrets are exemplified by breeders craftsmen Andes.Kuna tradition.Learn more andshop Kuna.

title: Artisan: Simon Alcantara
description: Simon Alcantara’sbackground as a professional dancer is evident in nearly every aspect of hisjewelrydesign, from his expert’s appreciation for balance and movement to the women who made up first fan base: ballerina friends. When an injury forced Alcantara retire dancing, he refocused energy fully on fine jewelry, which now incorporates stones, bones, mother pearl precious metals pieces that are simultaneously exotic elegant.Simon Alcantararemembers mentor, Oscar de la Rentaon JournalSee inspiration behind ourSimon AlcantaraExhibitionLearn more andshopSimon

title: Artisan: RTH
description: René Holguin opened his shop,RTH, onLos Angeles’sLa Cienega Boulevard in 2011. The son of an El Paso bootmaker, grew up between Mexican and American culture, cherry-picking the best aspects both channeling them into handworkedleather goodsand clothing. His father’s company, Laramie Boot Co., now partners with RTH on early production many leather goods. For other projects, he has reached out to collaborated groups artisans—like a community Blackfeet Indians Montana, whom produced line beaded accessories.René inLos Angeles where combines design heritage handworked goods.Learn more andshopRTH.

title: Artisan: From the Road
description: Founder Susan Easton, who trained as a graphic designer, regularly travels to far-flung corners of the world in search sublime artistry—all service her mission safeguard and promote heritage traditions that could otherwise be lost time. OurFrom Roadselection represents best those discoveries: eclectic jewelry rooted local aesthetics; soulfulknitwear; collection red, naturally dyed scarves from NepaleseHimalayas, all created under guidance master dyer working with indigenous dyestuffs—like walnut shells, pomegranate skins, roots, more.OurFrom discoveries designer Easton's world.Read more aboutSusan Eastonon Journal.Learn andshop From Road.

title: Artisan: The Good Flock
description: The Good Flockepitomizes the evolution of thePortlanddesign scene—from DIY ethos “putting a bird on it” to truly modern sensibility competitive with innovative creative communities around world. Flock makes pieces that reflect its philosophy: sustainable, handmade, and made last.All products are fully biodegradable.The last while producing biodegradable.Learn more andshopThe Flock.

title: Artisan: Aboubakar Fofana
description: Aboubakar Fofana is a calligrapher, artist, textile designer, and master indigo dyer. Born in Bamako, Mali, he now travels frequently between there, Paris (where has lived for over 30 years), Tokyo. Fofana, who utilizes the finest hand-woven fabrics, committed to preserving revitalizing Mali’s nearly lost tradition of natural vegetable dyeing.Aboubakar fabrics dyeing.Read aboutAboubakar Fofanaand ancient dyeing.See more inspiration behind ourAboubakar exhibition.Learn andshop Fofana.

title: Artisan: Norlha
description: Founded by the mother-and-daughter team of Kim and Dechen Yeshi,NorlhatrainsTibetan nomads to spin yaks' dense undercoats into a soft, highly durable fiber, suitable for use in brand's collection luxurious scarves, shawls, andblankets. Artisans learn Nepali Indian spinning weaving skills at Norlha workshop Tibetan village Zorge Ritoma—and through this income, reduce their reliance on traditional nomadic herding, which has previously led environmental problems associated with overgrazing.NorlhatrainsTibetan andblankets.Read about howNorlha hastransformed yak wool luxury accessoriesin JournalLearn more founderKim Yeshi's travel must-haves, favorite hotels, dream destinationsin andshop Norlha.

title: Artisan: Aiayu
description: Aiayumeans "soul" in Aymara, the language of indigenous Aymara people Andes. Danishknitwear designerMaria Hogh Heilmann founded AIAYU 2004 to celebrate and support work Bolivian artisans. She her team have created scores jobs inBolivia, employing a large artisans create Aiayu's sophisticated, streamlined knitwear—uniquely produced with patented "cashllama" fiber, renowned for its thermal durable qualities.Danishknitwear Heilmannfounded artisans.Learn more andshopAiayu.

title: Artisan: Colibri
description: Colibri is a shop in Guatemala's beautiful Colonial town of Antigua. title: Artisan: Makaua
description: Makaua was established in 2002 when its founders discovered a palm placemat Mexican market. Realizing they had stumbled across something special, went search of the people who made it. title: Artisan: Wayra
description: Wayrais a Peruvian family enterprise founded in 2003 by Mercedes Benavides specializing the production ofhandmade textilesusing natural, luxurious fibers such as alpaca wool, cotton, wool and other blends. We produce throws, bed blankets, pillows, shams, sweaters, gloves, shawls, scarves, hats many hand knitted, loomed, crocheted products. In Quechua, native language of Incas, Wayra means 'wind'. This word reflects our spirit represents ability to move with changing market dynamics requirements clients. are committed sustainable development work more than 2000 artisans highlands ofPeru, especially mining communities 3800 meters above sea level. under rules fair trade regions including Lima, Moquegua, Puno, Huancavelica, Junín, Trujillo & Cerro de Pasco.Wayrais handmade textiles using blends.Learn andshopWayra.

description: Dara Collections are the clearest expression of our philosophy. title: Artisan: Norlha
description: Founded by the mother-and-daughter team of Kim and Dechen Yeshi,NorlhatrainsTibetan nomads to spin yaks' dense undercoats into a soft, highly durable fiber, suitable for use in brand's collection luxurious scarves, shawls, andblankets. Artisans learn Nepali Indian spinning weaving skills at Norlha workshop Tibetan village Zorge Ritoma—and through this income, reduce their reliance on traditional nomadic herding, which has previously led environmental problems associated with overgrazing.NorlhatrainsTibetan andblankets.Read about howNorlha hastransformed yak wool luxury accessoriesin JournalLearn more founderKim Yeshi's travel must-haves, favorite hotels, dream destinationsin andshop Norlha.

title: Artisan: Wayra
description: Wayrais a Peruvian family enterprise founded in 2003 by Mercedes Benavides specializing the production ofhandmade textilesusing natural, luxurious fibers such as alpaca wool, cotton, wool and other blends. We produce throws, bed blankets, pillows, shams, sweaters, gloves, shawls, scarves, hats many hand knitted, loomed, crocheted products. In Quechua, native language of Incas, Wayra means 'wind'. title: Artisan: Makaua
description: Makaua was established in 2002 when its founders discovered a palm placemat Mexican market. Realizing they had stumbled across something special, went search of the people who made it.
